inn1.comm: nice and full in the channel, Tamim is crease-bound as he pushes and nicks it past the cordon to third man via a thick outside edge
width on offer again, Imrul finds the gap in the covers with a drive
good length and outside off, Kayes sits back and attempts another drive, this time he can only scoop it in the air.... but dies in front of cover
Panyangara drags his length back but veers down the leg side, the batsman rolls his wrists and helps it to long leg
tight line, this one largely holds its line on off, blocked
back of a length and on middle, Tamim is right behind the line in defence
full and targetting middle, blocked in front of covers
beaten soundly! Full and angling away outside off, beating the groping bat
fullish and on off, patted towards mid-on with some rather elaborate wristwork
pitched up and keeps going away with the angle outside off as Kayes tightens his technique, shows better judgement and leaves it be
full and sliding into the leg stump, weak flick to midwicket
fractionally short and outside off,  Kayes stands tall and punches it to backward point, who makes a diving save. This means Kayes plays out a maiden
short, width, parcelled up and dispatched! Tamim is up on his tippy toes, fetches this from outside off, controls the pull, and sends it wide of midwicket
tight line on off, trickled back to the bowler off an inside edge
glanced off the hips to long leg. Neat work from Tamim
shortish and outside off, the batsman rides it to point
back of a length and outside off, Kayes stands tall and punchily plays it to the covers
back of a length and on off, calmly blocked into the covers
short and tucks Tamim up for room. The opener adjusts and fends it in front of point
angled away just outside off on a fuller length from over the stumps, prodded to short midwicket
banged in short on a leg-stump line, but not much sting in the attempted lifter. Tamim swivels on the back foot and pulls a single to fine leg
good length, sticks up in the pitch as Kayes checks his drive and chips it in front of mid-off
picked away off the pads, easy pickings as Kayes beats the fielder chasing from square leg
Muzarabani directs this short one outside off, Kayes keeps back, rides the bounce, steering it down to third man
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line from round the stumps, blocked gingerly
angled outside off, dabbed to point
Kayes gets behind another incoming delivery, defending it to the off side
Kayes reaps reward for intent. Some fancy wristwork too on display. Good length and angled in on off, Kayes takes a step out and picks it up over midwicket for a six!
back of a length and around off now, defended
disciplined stuff. Off-stump line and that's patted into the covers
hammered in short and tucks up the batsman for room, fended to leg
lovely, flowy drive. Touch full and outside off, Tamim leans forward and caresses it between covers and mid-off
straight in line, Tamim plays the front-foot push back to the bowler
back of a length and seeking the top of off, Tamim, however, inches forward and knocks it defensively to mid-on
clipped off the pads towards square leg, though not firmly
dropped short and loads of room, Kayes loves it there. He slashes it with all his might and gives it marching orders past the covers. Poor ball and duly put away
length ball, push driven to off
good length and on middle, tapped to mid-on. The pair look for a quick single, but decide against it in the end
nice and full on off, straight-bat push back to the bowler
Tamim gets a confident stride forward and blocks another length ball
angled in on off, Tamim defends it to point and half-waves his bat to his partner
another incoming ball, another solid forward defence. Second maiden of the innings, this time from Panyangara
a tad overpitched on middle as Kayes a drills a ram-rod straight drive. The bowler intercepts with his left boot in the followthrough
blocked towards cover
blocks this again, this time off the back foot. This was on a back of a length on middle
Boom! Short and outside off, Kayes swings it up and over square leg. Strong wrists, again
fuller and on off, prodded in front of square leg off the inside half
pitched up and attacking middle, defensively pressed back
angled in on middle, driven to short cover
loose, loose drive from Tamim. Panyangara rolls his fingers across this full ball outside off, Tamim chases and misses. He did not spot the change of pace, and was early into the shot
back of a length and on middle, much better reply from Tamim. Straight-bat defence
nudged from an off-stump line towards square leg
Tamim strides forward and pushes a single to long-on
full and angled in as Kayes camps back and rolls it back to the bowler
pushed to mid-off, Tamim wants a quick one, but is sent back
two-bounce four! Tamim unleashes aggression now. He advances and belts it overs the covers
Tamim flits down the pitch again, makes some room outside leg as well but the bowler follows him. Punched to mid-off in the end
Jongwe sprays this slower ball down leg
another leg-side well and Tamim can't touch it
tickled off the hips to short fine leg
shortish and angling away outside off as Tamim races down the track.... and only connects with a whole lot of thin air
punchylicious! And Tamim freezes his pose for the cameras. Short and outside off, he stands tall and forces it past the covers. He has almost caught up with Kayes
full and on the stumps, punched back to the bowler
length and on off, defended off the front foot
another leg-side smite, third leg-side six for Kayes, and raises the fifty partnership. Taken from outside off and clattered over the boundary
short on middle, blocked back

sloppy work in the field. Bangladesh get four where there should have been none. Pitched up and outside off, push driven down the ground, the man from mid-off moves to his left, and lets it through his legs
might have been a slower ball outside off, ignored
full and angling away, Tamim clunks a drive to deep cover
full and ducks back in to catch the front pad but it may have pitched marginally outside leg. Umpire Dar isn't interested. Looked tight, though. Jongwe has his hands on his head
short on a leg-stump line, glanced to long leg
shortish and outside off, eased to third man with an angled bat
length and outside off, knocked to point
pitched up and on middle, pushed to short cover. Kayes was looking to go rather squarer
back of a length and on the hips, Tamim can't lay bat on the flick. Leg byes
length and angling away, Kayes loads up for a drive, and ends up mishitting it to mid-off

short and width outside off, slapped to backward point, where Cremer dives to his left but spills the catch. Zimbabwe's fielding has left a lot to be desired. They need to take their chances if they are to carve out a consolation win
pretty full and outside off, guided to backward point
full and outside off, another mistimed drive to cover
easily flicked off the pads through midwicket
glided down to third man for one as this was full and outside off. Nice, late dab from Tamim
overpitched on middle, driven crisply past the covers
and Tamim dabs another single down to third man
looks like an away-cutter outside off, waft and a miss
bouncer outside off, pull and a miss now
might have been another of the slower ones outside off, Kayes slashes but can't touch it again
back of a length and on middle, Tamim keeps back and chops it down to third man
short and outside off, flashy cut to sweeper cover
width on offer, carved away through the off side
back of a length and on middle, pushed towards mid-on
full and almost in the blockhole, squeezed out to short midwicket
shortish and outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length and on middle, defended in front of point
full and outside off, dips under the wildly swinging bat
eased off the pads through backward square leg
nice and full on off, caressed to mid-off
angled on off, Tamim drops it in front of cover and scampers to the other end
fractionally short on middle, weakly flicked to short midwicket
fullish and on the stumps, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
Tamim swivel pulls this short ball and finds the man at 45 on the leg side
short and just a shade outside off, Tamim throws his bat at it, under-edging it behind to the keeper
half-volley and Tamim latches onto it. He eases forward and crunches this past the covers, beats Panyangara, who is sweeping the boundary on the off side
length and outside off, forward and driven to short cover
short, does not rise much outside off. The batsman adjusts and pulls it to deep midwicket
hint of spin but down leg, helped fine on the leg side for a couple
full and on middle, Tamim bends forward in defence
Tamim jumps out of the crease as Raza pulls his length back, punchily defended
down the pitch is Tamim again, he manufactures a full toss and whips it to short midwicket, the fumble allows him to rotate the stroke
darted flat, Imrul secures a single behind square on leg
short and on middle, punched down the ground to long-on
back of a length and on middle, Tamim inches forward to block it to off
skewed drive from outside off towards long-on as Ervine fumbles at short midwicket
Kayes nips down the track, Chigumbura fires a lifter. Swing and a miss
length and outside off, slashed to short cover, where the fielder flings to his right and stops the ball
dragged to long-on, not from the middle of the bat
tap-and-run single in front of the covers. Easily done in the end
full and roll straight on, outside off, milked to long-off
hangs in the air and dips down the leg side, beats the keeper. Wide called
loopy full toss, punched to midwicket

down the pitch, manufactures a full toss, and whips to midwicket. The fielder flings a throw towards the keeper's end and pings the retreating Kayes on the side of the knee. He was seeking a scampered single but it sent back
tucked from middle and leg to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut away to the off-side sweeper
short ball, and that's punchily blocked to off
back of a length and angling away outside off, beaten past the outside edge as Kayes lazily slashes and misses
another bouncer outside off, sails over the flashing blade en route to the keeper
length and outside off, Kayes wants to drive and mis-hits it to short cover
banged in short and outside off, Kayes takes his eyes off the hook, but manages to find the gap behind square on the leg side. He seems to thrive on the leg-side gaps and boundaries
full and outside off, punchily square driven
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off for a quick one
slides on off, pushed to mid-off

Chakabva messes up a stumping chance. Kayes takes a step out, the bowler generates good turn and drift. Off the pad, the keeper can't collect it cleanly on the first attempt. He recovers, leans back to take it on the second. But the umpire isn't interested. Oh wait, replays pick up a tickle, an edge
pushed back to the bowler
grips in the pitch and rips past the outside edge
tapped towards covers
swept away to short fine leg
starts off a with a shortish ball, pulled away to deep midwicket
flicked to midwicket
down the track, Cremer held this one back. Worked to midwicket
tucked around the corner towards deep square leg. This means back-to-back fifties for Kayes. The crowd acknowledges his effort and so does Tamim with a handshake
punched off the back foot towards midwicket
rolls on straight, worked to the left of short midwicket
Tamim sits back and punches a single to long-on
darted flat, punched to leg off the back foot
slides on flat, forced wide of short midwicket
tossed up on middle, Tamim stretches forward to smother it
tucked off the legs to short midwicket as Chigumbura throws himself around and makes a diving stop
tossed up and spins away outside off, he dances out and does not connect properly with a leg-side swipe, edges it over the vacant cordon, the keeper had no chance. Googly weathered
slides on flat, swept firmly behind the square leg ump
looped up on middle, nurdled behind square
picked away to midwicket off the back foot as this was the quicker one from Cremer
extra turn and bounce, hits the thigh pad
drilled down the ground, to long-on as this was full and straight
top inside-out strike. Tamim Kayes races down the track and launches this over the covers with consummate authority
slides on outside off, slashed to sweeper
darted outside off, late-cut to the right of short third man, good diving stop
full toss on off, instead of smashing it away, the batsman bunts it long-on
straight roller on middle, nudged to square leg as Tamim brings up a fifty of his own in this century stand
drifting down leg, whipped behind square
extra bounce on this one, the batsman hangs back and takes it on the thigh
quicker through the air, Kayes goes down on one knee and sweeps it behind square, beats the man in the deep
worked to leg for one more
slides on outside off, Tamim plays for turn and is beaten
darted flat, Tamim dances out and blasts it down the ground for a six
flighted on middle, patted in front of the covers with soft hands
half-tracker outside off, smashed away, bursts through the fingers of the man at cover
Tamim dances out, the bowler follows him with a flat darter. Tamim is yorked and digs it out
pushed to the off side
paddled to short fine leg as this was drifting down leg
tossed up outside off, driven to the covers for one more
short ball outside off, steered to point
back of a length on middle, tucked wide of midwicket
fractionally short and outside off, Tamim semi-pulls it as the ball drops short of Ervine at short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punched to point
down the pitch, gets a full toss and drives it to off
full at the base of middle, poked back to Panyangara
too full and outside off, drilled between covers and mid-off
dropped short and outside off, walloped to sweeper cover

Raza halts the surging opening stand. Kayes jumps out of the crease, the bowler loops it up and finds some turn as well. Kayes has a big whoosh at it, and misses. Chakabva does the rest, though on the second attempt
dropped short, pulled behind square
flicked off the back foot to midwicket
stroked to the covers, the fielder dives to his right but fumbles, allowing the single
angled in on middle, chipped towards vacant mid-on.... but there is protection in the deep
fractionally short and on off, Mushfiq gets across to defend
dug in outside off, pulled away over midwicket
Panyangara grunts as he delivers this short ball. Defended. The extra effort causes him to go well over the line
yorker length on off, jabbed to midwicket
dug in short on off, Mushfiq rolls his wrists on it and steers it to the right of deep third man. The fielder gets across, dives well. Muzarabani saves two runs for the visitors
lifting short ball outside off, beats the diminutive Mushfiq on the hook
nurdled off the pads behind square
spinning down leg, wide
full and dips on off, whirl of the wrists as Mushfiq whips past midwicket
darted flat, Tamim keeps back and punches to short cover
slid on the leg stump, off the pad, and runs away to short fine leg
Mushfiq uses his feet and lofts this over mid-off. Good timing and awareness of the field
ticked towards square leg for one.. Smart batting
dragged short on off, Mushfiq ventures deep in the crease and pulls over midwicket. Not off the middle of the bat
flighted on middle as Tamim bends forward in defence
skiddy ball on middle, with extra bounce. Tamim steps away, makes room, and blocks it back
turn and bounce again, catches Tamim in a tangle and hits the thigh pad
tossed up, pushed to midwicket
hint of width outside off, Tamim leans back and chops it to the covers
back of a length on off. Hit-the-deck-hard stuff. Mushfiq stays back and dabs it to third man
short and hurries on, poked to short midwicket for a hustled single
picked away off the hips with a half-pull and half-whip
back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq hangs back and chops it to third man
good length and outside off, thrashed to deep cover. Sweeper runs around to clean up
banged short and outside off... Not short enough to trouble Mushfiq. He controls a pull and sends it behind square with a roll of the wrists
looped up on middle, defended back

No century for Tamim either. Cremer generates extra bounce again, Tamim aims to cut. He can only chop it over the top of the stumps. The keeper grabs the ball on the first bounce and takes the bails off. Given out as stumped, though. Tamim can't ground his bat in time
flat ball outside off, punched through the covers
tickled to short fine leg
shortish legbreak outside off, punched behind point
fired short, extra bounce to add to it. Kept out
too straight from Jongwe, flicked behind square, beats fine leg
Mushfiq opens the face and dabs a single to third man
back of a length and outside off, run away. Ervive has been installed at short third man now to prevent the single
pitched up on off, worked through midwicket
tight line on off, run away to point via an open face
skiddy ball, chopped wide of point off the back foot
fired down leg, wide
slog-swept away behind square on the leg side
full, flighted on middle, Liton sinks to one knee, slog-sweeps it over cow corner. Nearly holes out
punched with the spin to long-off
tossed up, off the pad and sneaks away, Ervine gets around to a leg-slip position from slip quickly and stops the ball
punched off the back foot through the covers
poked towards short third man as Mushfiq does not account for the turn. He wants a single but is sent back
loppy and slower through the air, patted to backward point
Chigumbura drops Liton at mid-off. Down the pitch and scooped in the air. The Zimbabwe captain grasses a simple chance. Sets a poor example on the field
nudged to leg
flat on off, turned off the back foot to midwicket
Waller gets Mushfiq in his first over. Mushfiq also leaves his crease, Waller darts it outside off. The batsman can't touch it. Dab and a miss. Third stumping for Chakabva
lobbed up on off, blocked
dabbed finer of short third man
pushed through covers after leaning back
pitched up and outside off, driven to long-off
lap-swept away from middle towards fine leg
poked to short fine leg
loopier on off, tapped to short cover
Liton bends his knee and lifts it over extra cover
punched down to long-on
down the pitch and dragged to mid-on off the inside half
slides on middle and leg, hit to long-on off the back foot
punched down to long-on, again
Liton strides forward and bunts this tossed-up ball back to the bowler
hurrying ball on off, punched to deep cover
worked to short fine leg
full ball that is prodded into the covers
slides on middle, blocked off the back foot
knocked behind square on the leg side for one
full and straight on middle, non-turning ball, which is punched back at the bowler
tossed up and outside off, Mahmudullah uses his feet and smears it past covers
angled down leg, diverted to the right of short fine leg
tucked around the corner for one
Mahmudullah held nothing back in this. He dances out, and slams it over wide long-on. Looks like he is hitting his way back to form
glanced off the hips behind square
Litton tries to do a Mahmudllah. He uses his feet, but does not come close to the pitch. Ends up nudging to short midwicket

taken at extra cover, sharp work from Wellington Masakadza, the substitute fielder. Liton steps out, uses his feet and smears this flighted ball in the air. The fielder dives to his right and completes a fine catch. Liton shakes his head as he walks back. He timed it well but did not get enough elevation
looped up on middle, tapped down the ground, to long-on
hurrying ball, slides on middle, chopped to short third man
tossed up and outside off, hoisted over extra cover
quicker length ball on off, defended
back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah keeps back and punches it straight to backward point
short and outside off, does not rise much. Might have been slower in pace as well. Pull and a miss
Mahmudullah runs down the track to distract the bowler, who sprays this wide outside off
shortish and off, played back down the ground
short and wide outside off, Sabbir cuts firmly... but can't keep it down. Good overhead catch at backward point by Cremer
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover
and again, caught Cremer bowled Jongwe. Dug in outside off again, slashed to backward point
heading down leg, glanced away fine of short fine leg for four
darted outside off, chopped to backward point
tossed up on middle and leg, nuggety nurdle in front of square for one
hint of turn, poked away past lone slip
pushed down leg again, Mahmudullah tickles it to the right of short fine leg. Second such four of the over

Bangladesh are falling away. Dragged short, Mahmudullah chops it towards covers and sets off.. Mashrafe, however, isn't interested. The fielder fires a bulls-eye throw, Mahmudullah is gone.... Oh wait, what do we have here? Drama! Chakabva breaks the stumps (accidentally) with his gloves before the direct hit thudded into the furniture. Mahmudullah survives. They check for a front-foot no ball now. It is fine. Mahmudullah joins his captain. Chigumbura does not look happy. He has a chat with umpire Dar. More drama here! Another angle shows that Chakabva had belatedly remedied his error, calling for the ball off the ricochet, and knocking a stump out . Is the play dead? Looks so. Umpire Dar has a chat with the TV umpire. Chigumbura then intervenes. The final verdict is NOT OUT.
length and outside off, right in the slot, as Mashrafe pastes it over the covers
clubbed away to the leg-side boundary
poked towards short third man
right in the blockhole at the base of off, angled to third man. No ball and free-hit coming up
low full toss, slapped to mid-off
low full toss, drilled to long-off
wild swing and a miss outside off
back of a length and outside off, forced past covers but there is protection in the deep
length and outside off, hacked to covers
tonked down to long-off as this was full on off
right in the blockhole on off, jammed back
jabbed to short third man as Jongwe hits the blockhole, again
good length and outside off, Mashrafe goes low on one knee and belts it over the covers
slippery bouncer outside off, Mahmudullah bails out of the attempted scoop at the last moment
yorker on off, squeezed to covers
width outside off, punished behind square on off, Mahmudullah beats third man. The bowler went for the yorker and ended up offering a low full toss
banged in short and outside off, pulled with a top edge, does not carry to deep midwicket. Lands in front of Ervine
full and straight, keeps a bit low. Mashrafe looks to slog but loses his balance and drags it back off the toe end. Played on and Panyangara has something to show for his disciplined bowling
pitched up and on off, swung away to wide long-on
low full toss on off, clunked through the off side
Jongwe can't nail the yorker again. Bunted to cover
right in the blockhole on middle and leg, whipped through midwicket
back of a length and on middle, Sunny can only defend it onto the pitch
full and outside off, crashed to long-off
full and outside off, Sunny drills a drive to long-off, and passes over the strike to Mahmudullah
too full and wide outside off, so much so it ends up as a full toss, Mahmudullah carves it away behind point for his first fifty plus score since the World Cup
Mahmudullah skips out, Panyangara pulls his length back. Mahmudullah swishes.. and does not connect
full toss, clubbed to deep midwicket

Mahmudullah has been run out, no drama here. Nice and full outside off, Sunny swings and misses.. He sets off as Mahmudullah wants the strike, Chakabva flicks an under-arm throw and catches Mahmudullah short

Another run out, to finish off the innings. Hurled full on off, Mustafiz goes low for the slog sweep. He checks his shot and drags it to long-on. He hustles for the second but is run out at the keeper's end

inn2.comm: Mustafiz serves up a warm-up ball. Deviating down the leg side, gently glanced to the long-leg boundary
bang, Mustafiz tilts the middle stump back as Mirpur roars. Pretty full and nips back in a bit to rip through the gate. Top, top ball, this, to follow the warm-up ball
fullish and holds its line outside off, nervous prod and a miss
pitched up and swings away outside off now, seduces the drive and beats the outside edge
Mustafir hits the repeat button! Full and in the channel, Ervine chases it with a loose drive and fails to put bat on ball
near yorker, jags back in, kept out
short and down the leg side as Chakabva lets it be
back of a length and on off, deflected to fine leg
length and outside off, defensively pushed to cover
fullish and outside off, forward prod to the covers
good length and on middle, defended
back of a length, sweetly pushed down the ground, bisecting mid-on and mid-on. Just an extension of a defence
whipped off the pads through backward square leg, fine leg had no chance
fetch that, says Chakabva. He steps out, meets this on a half volley and drives it between the bowler and non-striker
Mustafiz now hits back! The batsman uses his feet, again. Mustafiz pulls his length back and gets it to move away past the outside edge
good length and swings away outside off, Mustafiz snares the outside edge again, but this dies in front of Tamim at first slip, it sneaks away to the third-man boundary
there is the offuctter, Chakabva came down but had no clue about it
Chakabva steps out again as Mustafiz fires a bouncer. The batsman sways out of the way
full and on middle, no lateral movement. Chakabva leaves his crease, but check-drives it to mid-off
dabbed down to third man from outside off. This was full in length
full on middle, whipped through midwicket
full and on middle, Chakabva skips out and pokes it in front of square off an edge
beaten outside off
tickled off the pads to short fine leg
slipping down leg, Ervine can't touch it, off the pad and wanders behind to Mushfiq
Chakabva skews it to third man as he does not get hold of a leg-side hoick. Does not carry to the fielder
pitched up, holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge and dies in front of the keeper
pitched up and comes in to hit the pad but Ervine weathers the appeal, perhaps because of an inside snick
short and wide outside off, Ervive hops and chops it to the covers
tailing down the leg side, wide
hurled full and snakes back in, defended in front of mid-on
Chakabva aims to steer this full ball from outside off to third man but is beaten past the outside edge as Mashrafe gets some away movement
shortish and on middle, Chakabva looks for a pull but ends up dragging it to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
tucked away wide of midwicket, Liton dives in the deep, keeping it to three
intent from Ervine. He ventures down the pitch, manufactures some swinging room by jumping outside leg, and smacks it over mid-on
thick outside edge, wide of backward point, to third man
beautiful indipper from Mashrafe, leaving Chakabva prodding and missing. Zips past the inside edge
Mustafiz gifts some width outside off, punted over the covers for four
full and outside off, scooped in front of backward point. The fielder effects a direct hit but the pair pinch an extra run off the deflection
full and curls away with the angle outside off. Chakabva hangs his bat out, and gets beaten
another away-going ball, Chakabva skips out, edges it towards the cordon. He was nearly squared up
Mustafiz strikes, again! Looks like a slower cutter, Chakabva aims to loft drive. But is tricked by the lack of pace, and spoons the ball into the lap of Nasir at cover.. End of a scratchy innings
dragged from outside off behind square leg off the inside half of the bat
back of a length and on middle, Williams gets right behind the line in defence
full and on off, pushed back to Mashrafe
back of a length outside off, kicks up as well, forcing the batsman to sway away
flicked off the pads through midwicket
full and keeps low, blocked
tight line on off, blocked again
flighted on middle, pushed down to long-off
turn outside off, shoots low to beat Ervine
flighted and straight on off, Ervine answers with a dead bat

Ervine plays back and is trapped plumb in front. He should have been forward to that. Slides on quick and undoes Ervine, pinging him on the back pad. Mustafiz was setting up to bowl this over but Mashrafe and Tamim called in Nasir, who delivered
down the pitch and chipped to mid-on
reverse-swept away past slip to the boundary to silence the crowd. Efficient connection
full and comes in with the angle, defended
Chigumbura hangs back and does not meet with a cut. The ball keeps low and beats him neck and crop
back of a length, swerves in, and takes the thigh pad
back of a length, punchily stroked from outside off to the covers
on a length and too straight, clipped behind square on leg
fractionally short and outside off, hacked away over mid-on
full and on middle, blocked
reverse-swept away to backward point, finds the fielder
eased down to long-on
full and rolls on middle, defended from the crease
worked off the pads past midwicket
full and on middle, slog-swept away over midwicket
edged and just falls short of Kayes at lone slip. Disciplined line and length outside off, Chigumbura goes outside leg as he drives and outside-edges it..
banged in short and pulled behind square on the leg side
back of a length, played to the covers
veering onto the leg stump, off the pad and sneaks away square
dug in short, not high enough. Chigumbura drums a pull to the midwicket boundary
full and outside off, Chigumbura throws his bat at it, slicing to third man off a thick outside edge
slides on off, cut away past the covers off the back foot
darted flat on middle, punched to long-on
flat and quick, again, chopped to covers
full and outside off, tapped through the covers
ticked to square leg
worked off the pads to leg again
back of a length, keeps low, defended
full and on middle, pushed back
pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket. Good work by Sunny there in the deep
sliced drive to deep point
fractionally short, punched to backward point, where the fielder gets a hand onto it, taking some pace off the ball
short, punched back to the bowler
skiddy ball on off, blocked to cover
full toss, Chigumbura is on the move as he drags it behind square
driven smoothly to long-off as this was flighted outside off
back of a length and skiddy on off, Chigumbura leans back and slashes it to the cover boundary
prodded defensively in front of midwicket
back of a length and on middle as Williams camps back and blocks it to off
Williams drops back and flashes a cut to sweeper as this was short and outside off
really full at the base of off, jabbed to short cover
good length and on off, dabbed to point for a speedy single
punched to backward point
back of a length and outside off, cracked to deep cover
Sunny gives this loads of air outside off, Williams drives it crisply past the covers
Williams gives the charge, and goes inside out over the covers. He did well to meet the pitch before putting it away
darted full and quick, played back
Anamul nearly pulls off a screamer. Down the pitch and drilled to mid-off, where Anamul, the sub fielder, flies to his right and pouches it... but the ball bobbles out as his elbow hits the ground
shoots low and skids on just a shade outside off, play and a miss
straight ball and that's milked down the ground

a tad overpitched and on middle, gun-barrel straight drive, Al-Amin deflects the ball onto the stumps off his finger tips but Chigumbura, who had initially backed up, grounds his bat... and guess what? The ball still had enough legs to reach the boundary
full and outside off, Williams sits back and glides a single to third man
Chigumbura advances, the bowler pulls his length back. Off the thick inside half to backward square leg
banged in short, controlled pull behind square
Chigumbura stands tall and forces this from outside off to deep cover
pulled from outside off, short midwicket moves to his left to stop that hit
flighted on middle, flicked to midwicket
Chigumbura steps out, wants to launch it over midwicket... He ends up french cutting it, which evades the leg stump
quicker ball, slapped through the off side
flat darter, Chigumbura jumps outside leg and blocks
pushed defensively to short cover as this was tossed up and full
dropped shortish and outside off, punched to covers
short again, the line is on off, Chigumbura camps back and fends it in front of midwicket
back of a length again, Chigumbura stands tall, punches it to mid-off.. and sets off
fuller now, on off, to the left-hand batsman. Patted to cover
darted short and tucks up the batsman for room. Worked square on leg
Chigumbura rides the bounce of this lifting ball and runs it to point
half-tracker on middle, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket
full, non-turning ball, Chigumbura leans back and threads the gap between the covers and mid-off. A+ for placement
Sabbir fizzes it quick, tapped to off
dragged short, fended back to the bowler
hurrying ball outside off, Williams jams his bat down on it
Williams keeps back and helps this leg-stump ball to short fine leg. Off the pad, says the umpire
Williams skips out, manufactures a half-volley and directs it to long-off
fizzes off the pitch on off, extra bounce to add to it. Quelled to point
punched off the back foot through covers
flicked through midwicket
looped up, Sunny held this back on seeing Chigumbura coming down. Inside edged onto pad
scooped out of reach of short cover
rank long hop, duly swivel pulled away behind square
pushed back to the bowler
quicker ball, slides on, played back to Sabbir
Sabbir flights it, so much so he offers a low full toss. Bunted to long-off
worked around the corner for one

bowled'em. Pushed much quicker through the air, Chigumbura, who hangs back, can't connect with his leg-side whip. The ball scoots low and thuds into middle. Sabbir looks pleased and that's a big wicket for the hosts
flighted on the pads, Williams misses the flick
down the track and quietly blocked back

slid short, whipped off the back foot square on the leg side. Williams slides his bat, and completes the second run by the time Mushfiq whips the bails off. The TV umpire deems it Not out. The outcome is two
Williams skips out, Sunny held this back. Blocked
Williams almost spoons a return catch. Tossed up, the left-hand batsman checks his shot and chips it...
slid outside off, chopped off the back foot to backward point
tickled off the pads to short fine leg
flat on leg, paddled to short fine leg
full on middle, dug out
Waller dabs this off-stump ball in front of cover
nice connection from Waller. Dangled up on middle, Waller goes low and sweeps it firmly over backward square leg
flighted on middle, dinked through vacant slip with a reverse paddle
down the pitch, the bowler fires it quick. Jammed to midwicket
another hurrying ball, this is tucked off the pads through square leg
punched off the back foot to short cover
flighted delivery, patted through covers
turned to midwicket from a fourth-stump line
straight ball on off, dabbed in front of point
Williams goes down on one knee but misses the slog sweep as this was tossed up outside off
smoothly driven down to long-off for one
Waller invests in a tap-and-run single into the covers
skiddy and quick on off, Williams hangs back and chops it to backward point
Williams rushes down the track and secures only a single to long-off
diverted off the pads to long leg
flattish on middle, Waller keeps back and blocks to leg
even quicker through the air and Sunny catches the pad but this was snaking down
tossed up, lifted over extra cover. Pulled back with a slide in the deep
fired on middle, kept out
back of a length cutter on off, Williams is early into the shot as he chips it in front of short midwicket
pitched up on middle, picked away to the left of Mashrafe at short midwicket
full and leaves Waller outside off, dab and a miss
kicks up from a length outside off and keeps going away with the angle. Waller drops his wrists on it
fractionally short and cramps Williams for room. Prodded defensively to the leg side
flighted and dips on off, driven to short cover
poked to short cover now
forward and played to short cover, again
down the pitch and lofted over short cover after getting close to the pitch

clunked to short cover. Waller hunts for a quick single. He calls his partner but then sells him down the river. Williams runs back, slides.. Sunny had knocked the stumps with his left foot before under-arming it onto the furniture. Perhaps, he should have been behind the stumps to collect the ball
darted down leg, may have kissed the pad on its way to the keeper
full and outside off, Mustafiz invites the drive and hits the inside edge, which runs away beating short fine leg. Fifty for Williams
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
Williams drives again, or rather mistimes it back to the bowler
Mustafiz unfurls another cutter, scooped in front of short midwicket
floated outside off, push driven to short cover
Williams gets behind the line of this one on off stump and defends
slog swept to deep midwicket
down the pitch and pushed down the ground for one more
heaved away from outside off to deep midwicket
in the air but wide of cover. Sunny held this back as Waller skipped down. Hammered past the fielder
Sunny fires it flat, back cut away behind square on the off side, beats the two fielders there. Power followed by finesse
helped off the pads to short fine leg
length ball on off, pushed to cover
short ball on off as Mashrafe has Waller hopping and poking to backward point
back of a length and outside off as Mashrafe sucks pace off this, I would say that's a controlled outside edge to third man
whipped from a straight line to deep midwicket
dug short and outside off, chopped behind to keeper
swept straight to short fine leg, where the fielder fumbles, allowing one
Williams drags it from outside off to long leg thanks to a sweep of his own
darted outside leg, off the pad and pops to the keeper as umpire Dar turns down the caught-behind appeal
reverse-swept away through backward point
milked to long-on with use of the feet
good length and on off, patted to point
this stays low on middle and leg, poked back to the bowler
Williams makes some swinging room and drills it to mid-off, where the ball slips out of the fielder's hand. Signs of dew affecting Bangladesh?
run down to point, another misfield but Waller settles with a dot
full and on the stumps, pushed down to long-on
Mashrafe veers down leg, tickled fine on the leg side, the man at 45 hunts it down with some footy skills
full and wide outside off, Waller kitchen-sinks it away behind point off a thick outside edge
Al-Amin drags his length back on off, defended to cover
full and comes in a bit, poked back to Al-Amin

fine, leaping catch from Nasir. The returning Al-Amin provides the breakthrough. Good length and no movement outside off, Waller has a crack at it and loft-drives it... Nasir propels himself upward and snaffles it at cover
back of a length and on off, Raza angles it to point
Al-Amin tucks the new man up for room. Weakly flicked to midwicket
back of a length on middle as Williams makes room and thrashes it to cover
a touch overpitched on middle, driven to long-off
fractionally short on off as Raza camps back, whipping it to square leg
Mashrafe takes down Williams. He aims to step out, the Bangladesh captain bangs it short. He miscues it and Sabbir settles under the skier at short cover
Mashrafe greets Jongwe with a bouncer. He says no problem as he arches back and ramps it to third man
pitched up and just a shade outside off, driven to covers
short and outside off, Raza stands tall and thrashes it past the covers
tight line with extra bounce on off, Raza rides it to point
length and on off, played to point again
back of a length and outside off, that's punched to deep cover
looks like an away-cutter outside off, play and a miss
back of a length and top-of-off line, punched down the ground to the right of mid-off
Jongwe arches back and late-cuts this back-of-a-length ball to backward point
full and floated outside off, Jongwe is rooted to the crease, as he drives and misses
down the pitch and cudgeled over the covers. Longwe could not get under this full one
back of a length, pushed to long-on
Jongwe steps outside leg, this is pushed full and wide outside off. The batsman reaches out and carves it to backward point
Raza hops and punches this short ball on off to long-on
massive blow! Jongwe runs down the track and, adjusts to the slower ball, slugging it over wide long-on. He did well to manufacture his own pace
Jongwe skips out again, Al-Amin hurls it shorter and outside off. Slog and a miss
one for the over, gestures Dar. Lifter outside off, too high for Jongwe to ramp it over the keeper
Jongwe jumps down the track again. Al Amin is wary of it as he fires it short and pretty wide outside off. The batsman can't connect
Al-Amin tests Jongwe with another lifting short ball. The batsman takes his eyes off the hook as it balloons over backward square leg
full and cuts away outside off, Raza fishes and is beaten. There is that Mustafiz special

Sabbir plucks out a stunner after missing one earlier. He lands on his elbow again, but hangs on. Raza is sent packing. Nice and full on middle, Raza seeks to flick but loops it to the off side off a leading edge. Sabbir runs to his left from mid-on, dives full stretch to his left, snapping it up near the mid-off region. He takes his cap off and celebrates!
Mustafiz engineers a double-strike. Sabbir has another. Full again, Jongwe stretches forward for a sweep but can only mis-hit it. Sabbir takes a much easier catch at midwicket
Cremer averts the hattrick
back of a length and around off, guided to backward point. Anamul chases it down
flighted and outside off, pressed into the covers
turn and bounce, the batsman misses the flick. The keeper is beaten too
fired on middle and leg, Panyangara sweeps a single to long leg
slides on outside off past the groping bat
pushed through outside off, Panyangara can't touch this. Slog sweep connects only with air
short and on top of the stumps, chopped to off

Is that a return catch? Mustafiz claims the catch. They go upstairs. Whippy cutter from Mustafiz, Panyangara is early into the drive and spoons it back. It isn't a bump ball. The noise came from the bat jamming the turf. Third five-for in ODIs for Mustafiz in only his ninth game
pitched up and curls away outside off, poke and a miss
full on middle, blocked back
nice and full, cuts away outside off. Muzarabani is befuddled as he fishes and misses
yorker at the base of off, jammed into the cordon
drifts in with the angle on middle, dead batted
down the pitch and chipped in front of midwicket
That is that! Bangladesh sweep the series 3-0, they win the final ODI by 61 runs. Loopier and drifts in, another soft dismissal, sums up the story for Zimbabwe. Feebly chipped back to the bowler
